FuncDef: This command creates ranges of addresses on an Area Border Router (ABR) for the purpose of route summarization or suppression. When a range is created, the range is configured to be advertised or not advertised into other areas. Multiple range commands may be used to summarize or hide different ranges. In the case of overlapping ranges, the most specific range command applies.

ParaDef.Info: The IP prefix in dotted decimal notation for the range used by the ABR to advertise that summarizes the area into another area. Values-ip-prefix/mask:.

Specifies whether or not to advertise the summarized range of addresses into other areas. The advertise keyword indicates the range will be advertised, and the keyword not-advertise indicates the range will not be advertised. ParamDefault: Default- advertise
